pullRequest.body:
for `a`, `b` invertible. This will used to show the Breuillard-Green-Tao theorem in the case of matrices, which will then be bootstrapped to the full Breuillard-Green-Tao theorem.

From [GrowthInGroups](https://github.com/YaelDillies/LeanCamCombi/tree/master/LeanCamCombi/GrowthInGroups) (LeanCamCombi)

In the PR description, please replace GrowthInGroups with a link, and preferably add a sentence or two about where the need for this lemma arises.
Is this true in a seminormed ring?
It's actually stated like that in my repo. Looks like I pasted in the wrong section

perhaps
```suggestion
lemma norm_commutator_units_sub_one_le (a b : Î±Ë£) :
```
to leave room for a `DivisionRing` version as well.

... can you add that DivisionRing version? is the bound tight there?

No the bound is not tight because of the `â(a - 1) * (b - 1) - (b - 1) * (a - 1)â â¤ â(a - 1) * (b - 1)â + â(b - 1) * (a - 1)â` step. It is tight in a normed field. I guess I will add both versions
In a normed field the statement is pretty silly because the LHS is 0
Wait no of course the normed field version is not tight. The LHS is zero!
Can you add the `nnnorm` version too?
